text:
Morning all :smile:
I wasn’t sure where to put this but is there a way, maybe a serverless function, to look at a folder in the file system and then dynamically populate the frontend of a site with the file names from that folder?
Thanks in advance for any help :+1:

You can create a serverless function, which grabs data from the Files API, and sends it to HubDB through its API.
Then use HubDB to populate on the frontend.
This way you can further enrich the data, categories, more data and such for future filtering options.

You can also simply expose the data from the serverless function’s endpoint, and use frontend JS to display it with ajax.
Thank you <@UCBDLK6SU> that’s great I will look in to those two option :+1:
Yeah you definitely can create a custom object using custom code and create it through the api with whatever name you want it but would that defeat the purpose of trying to do it from the frontend?

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

hello everyone. I am doing the integration between HubSpot, zappier and the facebook pixel. I am following all the steps that facebook mentions in its implementation guide but I can't find the "facebook lead ID" field, I only need that field to finish the integration. Where can I include that field or create it? I leave you the facebook guide: <https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/conversion-leads-integration/zapier/step-1-implement-integration> . I hope you can help me. thank you so much.

Does anyone know of a way to disable line items entirely and/or how to trigger an action from the creation of a line item? (E.g. removing it?)

I've made a playbook that sets the properties I want in a deal, and a calculated property that generates the discount percentage and pushes the TCV to the amount field and flags if a discount percent is too high.

None of this triggers if users can create the deal via line item instead.

Do the excluded tags have posts? No
NO
